learningIntentions.text: Recall the basic structure and organelles of a cell distinguish between unicellular and multicellular organisms.
Identify that different types of cells make up the tissues, organs, and organ systems of multicellular organisms.
Outline the levels of organisation that make up organisms.
Explain that the systems in multicellular organisms work together to provide cell requirements.
Describe the role of the digestive system in maintaining a human as a functioning multicellular organism.
Describe the role of the circulatory system in maintaining a human as a functioning multicellular organism.
Describe the role of the excretory system in maintaining a human as a functioning multicellular organism.
Describe the role of the skeletal/muscular systems in maintaining a human as a functioning multicellular organism.
Describe the role of the respiratory system in maintaining a human as a functioning multicellular organism.
Outline the role of the reproductive system in humans.
Research an example of how changes in scientific knowledge have contributed to finding a solution to a human health issue.

Discuss how evidence from a scientific discovery has changed understanding and contributed to solving a real-world problem, e.g., animal or plant disease, hygiene, food preservation, sewage treatment, biotechnology.

Describe how developments in technology have contributed to finding solutions to a contemporary issue, e.g. organ transplantation, artificial joints/limbs, treatment for diabetes, asthma, kidney, or heart disease.

Discuss examples to show that groups of people in society may use or weight criteria differently in making decisions about the application of a solution to a contemporary issue, e.g., organ transplantation, control, and prevention of diseases.
